SEARCH
Package GUI

Class UI

java.lang.Object
GUI.UI
public class UI extends Object
The UI class is responsible for managing the graphical user interface logic of the application. It is integrated with JavaFX and communicates with the Program backend to manage users, processes, and event data for display and editing.

      Reference to the Program instance that provides backend logic.

      ListView UI component displaying user-specific process entries.

  • Constructor Details

    • UI

      public UI()

  • Method Details

    • onProgramReady

      public void onProgramReady(Program program)
      This method is called when the Program instance is ready and connected. It attempts to load existing users and initialize their associated data (processes/events), or prompts to create a new user if none exist.
      Parameters:
      program - the Program instance initialized at application start.

    • createUserWindow

      public void createUserWindow()
      Displays a window for creating a new user.

    • populateProgramList

      public void populateProgramList(int user_id)
      Populates the processes and events ListViews with data belonging to the selected user.
      Parameters:
      user_id - the ID of the selected user.

    • processEditMenu

      public void processEditMenu(ProcessInfo item)
      Opens an editing window for the selected ProcessInfo. If null, creates a new process.
      Parameters:
      item - the ProcessInfo object to be edited or null to create a new one.

    • eventEditMenu

      private void eventEditMenu(EventInfo evt)
      Placeholder method for editing an EventInfo.
      Parameters:
      evt - the EventInfo object to be edited.

    • refreshList

      public void refreshList()
      Refreshes the entire UI, including the user list and associated data.

    • updateMenu

      public void updateMenu()
      Updates the users menu and repopulates the ListViews with the current user's data.

    • populateUsersMenu

      public void populateUsersMenu(ArrayList<UserInfo> users)
      Populates the user selection menu with available users from the database.
      Parameters:
      users - an optional list of users; if null, they are fetched from the database.

    • initialize

      public void initialize()
      JavaFX lifecycle method. Called automatically after FXML loading.

    • addProcess

      public void addProcess()
      Handles the action for adding a new process entry. This will open the process editing window in "create" mode.

    • createUser

      public void createUser()
      Triggers the user creation window via a button or menu action.

    • deleteUser

      public void deleteUser()
      Deletes the currently selected user. Placeholder for delete logic (to be implemented).

    • showRunningProcesses

      public void showRunningProcesses()
      Displays currently running system processes in the console using the `tasklist` command. Works on Windows systems only.
